query.original: How to knit a sweater for a snake

results.title: r/snakes on Reddit: Got my first snake! Can I knit her a sweater?
results.description: Knitter and snake keeper too! I've thought about making a sweater for my Hogg Island, Ruger but I don't think he would like it. I do know some people who knit/crochet hides for snakes and other reptiles. Basically a large hat looking deal that they can snuggle into.

meta_url.path: › r/snakes  › got my first snake! can i knit her a sweater?

qa.question:
I got a young rosy boa yesterday. My first snake ever, and I adore her!

I like to knit. I thought it would be cute to knit a little snake cozy for her. I don't think it would be practical but it would be fun for me to do. But I don't know much about snakes. Would something like that be uncomfortable for her to wear? I wouldn't leave it on her for long periods at all, just now and then.

Please advise, would such a thing be distressing for a snake?

Thank you r/snakes :)

answer.text:
I would totally support you putting it on her for 30 seconds to take an adorable photo, once your snake is settled in and eating.

Nothing beyond that though. Snakes are cold-blooded anyway! If sweaters benefited them, they'd be born wearing them ;p.

extra_snippets: I do know some people who knit/crochet hides for snakes and other reptiles. Basically a large hat looking deal that they can snuggle into. ... Oooh, very good idea. ... Don't go up the tail, it pulls on the scales. Just present the sweater to the snake as the only option to go.

I like to knit. I thought it would be cute to knit a little snake cozy for her. I don't think it would be practical but it would be fun for me to do. But I don't know much about snakes. Would something like that be uncomfortable for her to wear? I wouldn't leave it on her for long periods at all, just now and then.

Posted by u/spidersoup - 12 votes and 19 comments

results.title: How Do You Make a Snake Sweater?
results.description: My boy loves soft small places ... have the supplies but absolutely no knitting experience. I tend to have good beginner's luck when it comes to crafty things but have found no tutorials or instructions online for snake-shaped sweaters....
extra_snippets: This is not an urgent question, but I am wondering if anyone has any links or tips to share on how to knit a tube-shape sweater for BPs. My boy loves soft small places so I figure I'll give him a sweater to see if he likes it (I won't force it if he doesn't). I have the supplies but absolutely no knitting experience.

items.question: How do I personalize items on Etsy?
items.answer:
Found something you love but want to make it even more uniquely you? Good news! Many sellers on Etsy offer personalized, made-to-order items.

To personalize an item:

  1. Open the listing page.
  2. Choose the options you’d like for the order. This will differ depending on what options are available for the item.
  3. Under “Add your personalization,” the text box will tell you what the seller needs to know. Fill out the requested information.
  4. Click “Buy it now” or “Add to cart” and proceed to checkout.

Don’t see this option? The seller might still be able to personalize your item. Try contacting them via Messages to find out!

results.title: knitting a snake on a sweater?
results.description: It's really just a long piece of flat knitting, tapered at the head. When you sew it on, you tuck a little bit of waste yarn or fiberfill under the head to get it to stand out. If you can find this book at your library, or Enchanted Knitting by the same authors, it's got lots of little tips.
extra_snippets: Has anybody seen a knitting pattern for a sweater that "appears" to have a snake (knitted) coiled around and around the wearer? Please email! Thanks! -------------------==== Posted via Deja News ====----------------------- http://www.dejanews.com/ Search, Read, Post to Usenet ... If you have a copy of Tap Dancing Lizard by the Cartwrights, they explain how to knit a snake and sew it anywhere you want on the sweater. results.title: How to Knit a Sweater: Beginner's Tips and Patterns
results.description: Learn how to knit your first sweater using these tips and easy patterns, essential skills, and easy sweaters for beginners.
extra_snippets: If you're a little nervous about knitting an adult-sized sweater, you can always start by knitting for a baby or child. Little sweaters contain all the same skills as bigger ones, but they'll finish faster, giving you more confidence in a shorter period of time.

This basic baby sweater, for example, is a great first sweater because it's all Garter Stitch and there's hardly any shaping at all. It'll knit up in no time, and if you don't know a baby, it's a great charity knitting project.

If you're looking elsewhere for sweater knitting patterns, look for projects in garter stitch, Stockinette, or other easy stitch patterns. You can choose a circularly knit project if you're comfortable working in the round; then you won't have to worry about finishing.

Once you've taken all the time needed to get gauge and knit all the pieces your sweater requires, take a little more time to sew your seams properly. Mattress stitch is essential for sewing side seams, while a horizontal seam works to join bound off stitches together, such as shoulder seams.

results.title: Enormous Stripey Knitted Snake : 4 Steps (with Pictures) - Instructables
results.description: Enormous Stripey Knitted Snake: This is a fairly easy project that mostly requires knitting in the round with no increases or decreases. We made it (or rather him) to live in my little brother's playgroup, so it is rather enormous being around 240cm long, which works well w…
extra_snippets: This is a fairly easy project that mostly requires knitting in the round with no increases or decreases. We made it (or rather him) to live in my little brother's playgroup, so it is rather enormous being around 240cm long, which works well with several kids playing in different places along the snake, but probably it should be scaled down for home use.

So... CO 8 stitches and distribute them evenly between 4 dpns (double-pointed needles, the ones you knit socks with) and join the knitting to start the round. Row 1: needle 1 - kfb, k1; needle 2-k1, kfb; needle 3 - kfb, k1; needle 4 - k1, kfb. Row 2: k all. Row 3: needle 1 - kfb, k2; needle 2-k2, kfb; needle 3 - kfb, k2; needle 4 - k2, kfb.

Continue until you have 48 sts (12 on each needle). Knit (k) 12 rows. Decreasing Row 1: needle 1 - k1, k2tog, k to end; needle 2 - k to last 3 sts, ssk, k1; needle 3 - k1, k2tog, k to end; needle 4 - k to last 3 sts, ssk, k1. Row 2: k all/ Row 3: as Row 1. Continue until you have 40sts.

Begin knitting on the round with a different colour, and change colours every few rows to make colourful stripes. It can either be a pattern, or just random colour combination - this is the place to be creative... In other words: knit, knit, knit... Until you run out of all the colourful yarn and have about a half of a ball of green left for the tail.

extra_snippets: Knitting a sweater can be a daunting project for someone who is just beginning to knit. However, it is much easier than it might seem. You can knit a sweater by following a very basic pattern. After you feel more comfortable with this basic sweater pattern, you might have the confidence to try more advanced patterns in the future.

Before you start your sweater, make sure you know how to knit stitch, purl, and count knitting rows. Then, measure around your chest to find your target size, and make sure you have 4-5 skeins of yarn. As you knit, keep your tension as even as possible!

Get plenty of yarn. After you have determined your size, you will be able to purchase your yarn. The amount of yarn you will need will depend on the size sweater you want to make.[2] X Expert Source · Jen Webber Knitting Specialist Expert Interview. 4 August 2020.

Gather your tools. In addition to your yarn, you will also need some special knitting tools to make your sweater.[5] X Expert Source · Jen Webber Knitting Specialist Expert Interview. 4 August 2020. Before you begin, you will need:
